text: Thanks <@UKQP9KM8A>. For some reason I thought `{{ related_blog_posts.count }}` would do the same thing… That didn’t even enter my mind once I got stuck on `count`! You’re awesome
out of curiosity, is it possible to have relative paths in custom modules?
Ideally everywhere you use a path you should be able to use a relative path
okay -- I'm getting what seems to be an odd result with my macro.html pathing in that it isn't letting me refer to the parent folder in a relative way.

I have a file that lives here:
`redesign/templates/partials/macros.html`
that I am attempting to reference in a `module.html` file located here:
`redesign/modules/module/module.html`

In other files outside of modules I am able to use something such as `./../partials/macros.html` perfectly fine, but within my `module.html` I cannot get the pathing to register without the direct reference to the parent folder name. `/redesign/templates/partials/macros.html`

This is problematic as the parent folder name could be variable
Maybe I'm just messing up the path?
I would think that it would be `./templates/partials/macros.html` but no dice on any variant of that
cc <@UBDMV6Y9Y> I think he has looked at a similar problem before
i have had issues with relative paths because it seems that the path is relative to the "root" template module that the web or landing page is using... not relative to the module or macro or partial
